verses.text: Then again Abraham took a wife , and her name \add was\add* Keturah.
And she bare him Zimran , and Jokshan , and Medan , and Midian , and Ishbak , and Shuah.
And Jokshan begat Sheba , and Dedan. And the sons of Dedan were Asshurim , and Letushim , and Leummim.
And the sons of Midian ; Ephah , and Epher , and Hanoch , and Abidah , and Eldaah. All these \add were\add* the children of Keturah. \p
¶ And Abraham gave all that he had unto Isaac.
But unto the sons of the concubines , which Abraham had, Abraham gave gifts , and sent them away from Isaac his son , while he yet lived , eastward , unto the east country.
And these \add are\add* the days of the years of Abraham’s life which he lived , an hundred threescore and fifteen years.
Then Abraham gave up the ghost , and died in a good old age , an old man , and full \add of years;\add* and was gathered to his people.
And his sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah , in the field of Ephron the son of Zohar the Hittite , which \add is\add* before Mamre ;
The field which Abraham purchased of the sons of Heth : there was Abraham buried , and Sarah his wife. \p
¶ And it came to pass after the death of Abraham , that God blessed his son Isaac ; and Isaac dwelt by the well Lahai-roi. \p
¶ Now these \add are\add* the generations of Ishmael , Abraham’s son , whom Hagar the Egyptian , Sarah’s handmaid , bare unto Abraham :
And these \add are\add* the names of the sons of Ishmael , by their names , according to their generations : the firstborn of Ishmael , Nebajoth ; and Kedar , and Adbeel , and Mibsam ,
And Mishma , and Dumah , and Massa ,
Hadar , and Tema , Jetur , Naphish , and Kedemah :\f + \fr 25.15 \ft Hadar: or, Hadad\f*
These \add are\add* the sons of Ishmael , and these \add are\add* their names , by their towns , and by their castles ; twelve princes according to their nations.
And these \add are\add* the years of the life of Ishmael , an hundred and thirty and seven years : and he gave up the ghost and died ; and was gathered unto his people.

And they dwelt from Havilah unto Shur , that \add is\add* before Egypt , as thou goest toward Assyria : \add and\add* he died in the presence of all his brethren.\f + \fr 25.18 \ft died: Heb. fell\f* \p
¶ And these \add are\add* the generations of Isaac , Abraham’s son : Abraham begat Isaac :
And Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah to wife , the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Padan-aram , the sister to Laban the Syrian.

And Isaac intreated the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* for his wife , because she \add was\add* barren : and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* was intreated of him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.
And the children struggled together within her ; and she said , If \add it be\add* so, why \add am\add* I thus ? And she went to enquire of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto her, Two nations \add are\add* in thy womb , and two manner of people shall be separated from thy bowels ; and \add the one\add* people shall be stronger than \add the other\add* people ; and the elder shall serve the younger. \p
¶ And when her days to be delivered were fulfilled , behold, \add there were\add* twins in her womb.
And the first came out red , all over like an hairy garment ; and they called his name Esau.
And after that came his brother out , and his hand took hold on Esau’s heel ; and his name was called Jacob : and Isaac \add was\add* threescore years old when she bare them.
And the boys grew : and Esau was a cunning hunter , a man of the field ; and Jacob \add was\add* a plain man , dwelling in tents.
And Isaac loved Esau , because he did eat of \add his\add* venison : but Rebekah loved Jacob.\f + \fr 25.28 \ft he…: Heb. venison was in his mouth\f* \p
¶ And Jacob sod pottage : and Esau came from the field , and he \add was\add* faint :

And Esau said to Jacob , Feed me, I pray thee, with that same red \add pottage;\add* for I \add am\add* faint : therefore was his name called Edom.\f + \fr 25.30 \ft with…: Heb. with that red, with that red pottage\f*\f + \fr 25.30 \ft Edom: that is Red\f*
And Jacob said , Sell me this day thy birthright.
And Esau said , Behold, I \add am\add* at the point to die : and what profit shall this birthright do to me?\f + \fr 25.32 \ft at…: Heb. going to die\f*
And Jacob said , Swear to me this day ; and he sware unto him: and he sold his birthright unto Jacob.
Then Jacob gave Esau bread and pottage of lentiles ; and he did eat and drink , and rose up , and went his way : thus Esau despised \add his\add* birthright.
